com.itko.lisa.coordinator

Class ReportGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.coordinator.ReportGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedType, TestEventListener, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class ReportGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements TestEventListener, NamedType, java.io.Serializable
    This base class implements the context support for any means you wish to listen for test events and publish them to the obvious places, like the screen, printer, database, or file.

    This class supports the TestEventListener interface. If you want to participate in this handy way of filtering and managing events, then don't directly support that interface, but instead derive from this class.

    See the methods below for more, but every derived ReportGenerator must support an initialization section for any possible custom parameters, and the actual pushEvent method to take an event and persist it in your special way.

    To be hooked into the Test Manager so you are available to be used in a Staging Document, you must modify add your class to the typemap.properties file or create a .lisaextensions file.

    public ParameterList getParameters()
    Used to tell LISA what parameters you need for your report (like the name of the file you will write events to, or the database connection info for writing to a db).

    public void initialize( ParameterList pl )
    This is how LISA gives you back those parameters when a test has been started and you have been requested to participate. This should have a Parameter object for each parameter that you provided in the getParameters() call above.

    IMPORTANT INFO: You know the test is over when your pushEvent() is called with a TestEvent of event ID TestEvents.EVENT_TESTENDED. If you need to clean up, that would be the time.

    See Also:
    TestEvent, for a discussion of which to use, Serialized Form

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize(ParameterList pl)
                         throws TestDefException
        This abstract method must be implemented by the subclass to do any processing of custom Parameters that are defined per this subclass' spec.
        Parameters:
        pl - is the ParameterList that was read from the XML doc of the ReportGenerator tag
        Throws:
        TestDefException

      • getParameters

        public abstract ParameterList getParameters()
        Method called by interactive test case editors to find out what the parameters for a given consumer are; Note that you must be able to handle updates to this list and not return a new copy every time.
        Returns:
        the ParameterList object that represents the attributes saved in this Event Consumer

      • getDocumentation

        public java.lang.String getDocumentation()
        You should override this method so that users will have a more complete understanding of how this reproting generator works. It's not abstract only b/c we don't want to break exsiting reporting generators in the field.
        Returns:
        an explanation of how this report generator works (where and what it stores for example)

      • isUserAllowedToSetEventFilter

        public boolean isUserAllowedToSetEventFilter()
        Method called by interactive test case editors to figure out how whether we need to offer the event filter or not It's really really important for you to set the filter by calling setFilter() in the ctor of the ReportGenerator b/c we'll register with that filter really quickly
        Returns:
        true if you want to allow the user to set the event filter
        See Also:
        setFilter(int[])

      • isAllowedOnSuite

        public boolean isAllowedOnSuite()
        Should this report be offered at the Suite level?
        Returns:
        true if you want to allow the user to put this report on a suite

      • isAllowedOnStagingOneTest

        public boolean isAllowedOnStagingOneTest()
        Should this report be offered in a 1-test staging doc?
        Returns:
        true if you want to allow the user to put this report on a 1-test staging doc

      • pushEvent

        public abstract void pushEvent(TestEvent ev)
        Abstract method that the sublcass must implement so we can get the event down to the custom code for this type of EventConsumers
        See Also:
        TestEvent

      • finished

        protected abstract void finished()
        When the report generator is convinced that we are done here and all we need to capture has been captured, then we are ready to wrap it up. File-based reports will want to finish writing their output and close their files.
        Since:
        2.7 we used to require the individual reports to know when to end, but suites have made that more complex, so we moved it into this based class

      • setCoordinator

        protected void setCoordinator(Coordinator c)
        Called internally to give Report Generators the handle to the Coordinator
        Parameters:
        c - our test's Coordinator

      • getCoordinator

        public Coordinator getCoordinator()
        Our implementations will need this to do interesting reports. When the test is running, subclasses can call this method to get the handle to the Coordinator that is staging this test.
        Returns:
        our Coordinator

      • isSuiteCoordinator

        public java.lang.Boolean isSuiteCoordinator()
        Will tell you if we are reporting on a whole suite of tests (true) or not (false). Null means we do not yet know because our Coordinator has not been assigned. This happens prior to the first event being generated, so feel free to assume you'll get a value in a subclass invocation of pushEvent()
        Returns:
        Boolean.TRUE if a we're reporting on a Suite, Boolean.FALSE if not (it's 1 test), or null if we don't know
        Since:
        2.7

      • setCompletedReportKey

        protected void setCompletedReportKey(ReportKey key)
        If you are the kind of report that is generated into the reports directory and you have a key, please call this method to make that key available to people AFTER your report is ready.
        Parameters:
        key - ReportKey of the report you have generated

      • autoGenReports

        public void autoGenReports(ReportKey key)

      • getCompletedReportKey

        public ReportKey getCompletedReportKey()
        If this is a type of report that has a Report Key (stores into the reports directory) AND the report is complete (no in-process reports!), then you can get the key to that report here.
        Returns:
        ReportKey to the completed report

      • testEvent

        public void testEvent(TestEvent ev)
        The method that is called by the TestEventMgr when there's an event to process. We call down into our subclass. This method is superfulous right now b/c nothing else happens here, but we might want to queue them to increase concurrency.
        Specified by:
        testEvent in interface TestEventListener
        Parameters:
        ev - the TestEvent object we've been given to process
        See Also:
        TestEvent

      • getFilter

        public int[] getFilter()
        Returns the filter we're using
        Returns:
        the current filter

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(int[] filter)
        Allows us to change our filter at runtime, BUT there are optimizations "above" us that you must handle, otherwise, this may be meaningless...
        Parameters:
        filter - new filter to use
